name: Fiesta Banana Nut Cake
author: Revella Schlosser

ingredients.name: c. sifted Swan's Down cake flour
c. mashed bananas (2 or 3 fully ripe)
c. minus 2 Tbsp. sour milk (with butter, margarine, or lard)*

instructions: *With vegetable or another shortening use 1/2 c. sour milk. Measure flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar into the sifter. Measure shortening into mixing bowl. Measure sour milk and vanilla into cup. Have bananas, eggs, and nuts ready. Stir shortening just to soften. Stir in dry ingredients. Add 1/4 cup of milk and the bananas and mix until all of the flour is dampened. Then beat 300 strokes by hand or 2 minutes with the mixer at low speed. Add remaining milk, nuts, and eggs. Beat 150 strokes by hand or 1 minute with mixer. Bake at 375Â° for 25 minutes in 2 greased 9 inch pans.
